place.name: LAMBSTON
place.gazetteerText: LAMBSTON, a parish in Haverfordwest district, Pembroke; near St. Bride's bay, 3 miles W by N of Haverfordwest r. station. Post-town, Haverfordwest. Acres, 1,761. Real property, £1,321. Pop., 216. Houses, 50. The property is divided among a few. The living is a p. curacy in the diocese of St. Davids. Value, £164. Patron, Pembroke College, Oxford. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
